lines.text: I'm through with mouthpieces. They take the fees, and I take the rap! Ahh!
As for me, I'd rather see a hundred guilty men go free than convict another innocent man.

[answering the phone]
Mr. Scott's office.
[pause]
No, this is not the Safeway Cleaners and Dryers!
[hanging up]
Some idiot wants his pants pressed. Maybe we oughta get a new number.
Not so fast. We may be pressing pants again.
Get up that $10,000, or you won't be chasing ambulances anymore. They'll be chasing you!
Then it's all settled? They won't prosecute me?
No.
You're not going to keep all of my $10,000?
Your $10,000? You stole it; I earned it!
But that's all I got. You wouldn't take everything I have, would you?
You can get out of town and keep going before you lose more than money.
Well, every time you go into a courtroom, it's a gamble.
I'm the house, Victor. I never gamble!

[drunkenly]
Told you to make it a double!
I did, Mr. Scott.
I want you to know, Victor, that you'll be very well paid for this case, whichever way it turns out.
